answers.answer: Is that when they give you the drink for glucose testing?? IF so, I am to drink the test drink before my next visit in a few weeks at 26 weeks....Unless what you are talking about is something different..

Nope.  I think that would be it.  I think so anyway.  First pregnancy and not real sure of how they do things.  My doctor doesnt explain anything if it means spending more than 5 minutes in a room with you.

I have mine today. Im 28 wks. My flavor is fruit punch...oh goody. I have to drink it while I am giving a massage before I go see my midwife (hopefully I wont puke it up). Should be interesting. This is my first as well and she said she will be drawing blood as well. Hope I pass it.

This is my first pregnancy as well, and my doctor gave me my bottle at 22 weeks to drink before my appointment in a month. So by then I'll be 27 weeks along. I'd say it's most likely done between 25-28 weeks, but don't quote me on that. :)

I'm not sure if this is what they do everywhere, but at my last visit last week at 22 weeks, they gave me a little bottle of what looks like orange soda and a list of instructions on when to drink it (Before you go in for your visit, and then they will take a urine sample)..This is my second pregnancy, so I have done it before. It is fine, it doesn't taste that bad, but I had horrible heart burn w/ my first (and starting to get it bad w/ this one) and the drink gave me such a bad heart burnt that I was unable to finish the bottle, even though you are instructed to drink the entire bottle. The nurse told me it is done around 25/26 weeks.

If you doctor is like that now, early in the pregnancy..........LEAVE!!! I kept sticking with mine because I thought he'd get better and start spending more time with me in the office and things have only gotten worse!Anywho....my GD test was done at 27 weeks. However, I do believe that they sstick your urine for it from the start.

there is a couple varieties. the glucose challenge can be done sooner if they feel you are high risk for developing gd. the gtt is done at about 28 weeks and the 3 hour gtt is done asap if you fail the first gtt. at least that's what i made of what my doctor had to say. if you pass the glucose challenge or 1 hour gtt you don't have to do any other tests.i failed them all and am on insulin injections for the next 8 weeks :(
How are you doing with all that?  I am sorry you have to go through that.  But I am sure it will be worth it in the end to have 2 healthy babies.  Good luck with the rest of your pregnancy!! =o)

it's not horrid. i already eat sensible. i did have to add more snacks into my day. seems like all i do is eat now!honestly the gestational diabetes just means i spend about 30 minutes a day in all poking a finger or my forearm and taking a shot. it's not as big of a deal as it sounds or seems when they give you the news.trust me on that, i know i was panicked. lol.thanks for the good luck. heaven knows i am the one who needs it.  :P
